cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi SSE of Cabo San Lucas, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north-northwest over southern Baja California Sur today, then turning northwest and emerging into the Pacific west of Baja over the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern tip of the Baja California peninsula near Cabo San Lucas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Baja California Sur from Puerto Cortes to east of La Paz; Tropical Storm Watch: Pacific coast of Baja north of Punta Abreojos to Punta Eugenia, east coast north of Mulege to Bahia De Los Angeles, and mainland Mexico north of Bahia Kino to Puerto Libertad
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Baja California peninsula from Puerto Abreojos to Mulege and mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Bahia Kino
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Baja California Sur, western Mexico Pacific coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds reaching the Los Angeles area late in the 4–5-day period; otherwise typical coastal breezes
weather_observation.rainfall: None expected beyond normal marine layer drizzle; heavy rain confined to Baja California and western mainland Mexico
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells may reach Southern California beaches this weekend, generating higher surf and rip-current risk but little operational impact inside the Port of Los Angeles
